text: AWS backup is the simplest way to manage
backups in AWS it's a centralized backup
service that provides an easy and
cost-effective way to automatically
protect your application data across AWS
services in the AWS cloud and
on-premises using AWS Storage Gateway
AWS backup provides a central console
where you can manage the backups of all
the AWS resources your application
relies on such as EBS volumes RDS
databases EFS file systems and more you
can configure and audit the AWS
resources you want backed up automate
backup scheduling sent retention
policies and monitor all recent backup
and restore activity AWS backup is easy
to set up
simply go to AWS backup management
console and with just a few clicks you
can create a policy called
a back-up plan that defines how
frequently to backup your AWS resources
and how long to store those backups you
then assign your AWS resources to backup
plans using tags and AWS backup will
start automatically backing up your AWS
resources and managing backup retention
on your behalf according to rules you
define AWS backup streamlines business
and regulatory backup compliance by
providing a single centralized backup
console set of api's and CLI to manage
an audit all your backups in AWS with
all your backups in one place it's easy
to find the backups you need when you
need them and audit which of your
resources are protected and how they are
being backed up to ensure compliance AWS
backup is a fully managed service that
scales up and down based on your backup
needs
there is no set-up cost for AWS backup
and you pay for only what you use to get
started visit aws.amazon.com slash
backup and create your first backup plan
using AWS backup in just a few clicks
